values:
These are a few of my thoughts concerning this past week or weeks.

Television

October Road
Last week I watch the season finally of October Road.  I love that show and I hope that ABC brings it back next season.  I know that there is talk that the show will not return next season, which made think that ABC should of not been the network to bring it to the air.  Thursday is not a good day for a new show to air.  Thursday is a good day but that is one of the most watched nights on Television.  People will go with that they know that.  So please ABC bring it back but maybe if you are looking to score high rating, have it come on another night of the week.

Heroes 
Heroes came back and I am highly excited.  It is interest how I am always looking forward to seeing it each and every monday.   If you guys are looking for a new character with super powers, I will be more than happy to join the cast. 

The Real World

Now to topics that have been thinking about this week and maybe last.

He robbed for hope
I am sure that many of you may of heard about the man that rob a bank in the hopes of receiving a meal.  He was not able to find work that would pay him more than minimum wage and at the age of 63 it is pretty hard working 3 jobs to make ends meet.

When I first heard about this, I thought that it was sad.  Prisoners have health insurance, 3 meals daily and other benefits that many people that are paying those taxes cannot enjoy.  Yeah what a country....

They are releasing him, which I have not problem with really, you do what you have to do to survive.   Its just that the next person is going to think that things like this is okay and the cycle begins.  


Health Care?
Lately is seems as if providing health care as become a competition.  I understand the need for a good name, I really do.  Colleges do it all the time.  Every university that I have attended has be a big ten schools.  The title is used to suck you into there schools and it works, well at least for me it did.  They say that when you see that wonderful name on your resume its boosts your chance of getting a great job. 

It is just that lately I have been hearing and seeing commercials, advertising how great their hospital is compare to others.  As I stated before, I understand the need for the name, but these are people lives.  There is basically a competition for human live.  Come to our hospital we have the best everything here, you don't want to be some were, the can't help you.  This could even be for funding, I guess the more people that come here the more money we'll get.  

I am not trash talking the profession, I respect it.  There are always rumors about hospitals and people want to go to the best health care possible.  Could there be a system were the hospitals come together to save lives, you know the initial mission.  

The money for the commercials could be used to help someone that happens to come in with no health insurance.

Welcome back

Soldiers came back home and I am so happy for them.  

I will be back to continue my thoughts

The semester has come to an alt and the question then becomes will I continue to blog?  The answer is yes.  I have come to realize that I always have a lot to say and this is a great for people to hear me roar, lol.  I know bad joke.  

Today I want to talk about something that I heard in the news.  It bothered me to hear this because I begin to think of our this country talks about being the best.   An announcement was made about funding being cut from public school systems in Michigan.  Are you serious, the US can cough up billions of dollars for the war but we can not continue to keep schools open or fund the students in school.  

It begin to upset me.  I mean, come on.  I was a Public School student.  When I was in school,  I remember using books that looked like they were better off being burnt.  Or desks that at any moment could break down and consume me in the process.  And the lunch, oh let me just say this begin my great hate for chocolate milk and sloppy joes.  I guess after throwing something like that up, it scars you for a long long time, no matter how much you enjoyed those things before the incident.  My point is that the school systems need as much money as they can get.

What a great Friday!!!!  Well the great Mayor of Detroit has released the budget for the fiscal year of 2007 - 2008 and to think that I thought he was doing nothing but building a house in Florida.  I am not saying the rumor is true but if it was it really does not affect me.....  Well anyways, the Mayor has proposed ways of saving the city, by selling, selling, and selling.  I guess if we can't maintain it why keep it or if it would help the city more by selling why not.   The Mayor is making an effort to do something, which is a lot better than what I am doing.  I just moved back to the city and to see the new construction makes me smile, but to turn around and see the buildings that used to be there aren't being used anymore.  The sad thing is that many people don't care, there are so many things going on that affects the residents of the city everyday and people are not opening their eyes to see that far.

I was final able to present my photo essay and I must say that I did not expect it to make such a discussion.  I was hoping that no one would of had any questions or  anything, but boy what I wrong, lol.  I used the word stereotypical and for some reason I thought that everyone, had the same meaning for that word, but I guess not.  I started off by showing images of Detroit that I felt that many in the class thought of when they saw Detroit and named that the stereotypical view.  Stereotypical because many people of think of the worst possible image and thats it, not acknowledging the positive at all.  After a strong discussion, I have come to realize that no matter what, some people will never change their view about many things.  The negative press that the city of Detroit has adopted is here to stay in the hearts of many.

First Comerica announced they were moving to Dallas, Texas whats next our police force?  Well no exactly, you see Comerica made the decision because it was hard to get people to come to Michigan.  So I guess they said, well lets go to a place where people will come to.   And to think, most people did not know that Comerica's headquarters was in Detroit to start of with, when they heard the news, they said well lets go to another bank.  Right, lets get all of our money out of that bank and go else where, because the bank tellers, managers and customer service personnel will lose their jobs and that will cause the unemployment rate in Michigan to go higher, gee willikers that's a mighty good idea.    Michigan has enough problems why not add to it. 

Well anyways the reason I decided to blog today was because something interesting caught my eye.  I was flipping through the Detroit Free Press and I happened to land on the classified section, yeah I know thats a big deal.   But anyways I saw a ad for the Dallas Police Department, I usually don't read this section I thought it was funny to see this.  First Comerica now the man and woman of the police force that have been laid off by the state due to budge cuts.  To be fair there is also an ad for the Fairfax County, Virgina Police test ad is right underneath it. 

Michigan needs to get on the train of success soon.  We are loosing out on too much too soon.

A few days ago in class someone raised the question, will the new houses being build be kept up?  To me that was a great question since I was doing my research paper on the development of Detroit, trying to showcase the improvement that the city is making.  I took a look at the Jefferies Projects and other houses in the city of Detroit to understand why many people who not support the new housing projects.  I drove around neighborhoods and to Woodward to see the new projects and wondered if one day these houses or apartments would end up like the abandoned. 
         The question then came up about the government helping to improve the old houses.  In all honesty, I believe that the government rather tear down the house then to fix it.  
         Well anyways, nothing lasts forever and neither will these new houses and apartments popping up all over the city, but something can be done to maintain them so they do not end up "abandoned".  The truth is that one these houses will become old and maybe abandoned and someone will have a vision to restore the area and the cycle continues.

And to think that I have always defended this city to the best of my ability, to just realize that many people do not care about the city that they were born and raised in, disgusting. I wasn't born here but I have lived here for a long time and the 6 people that I hold dear to my heart live here as well, so in some sense of it this is home to me.
       I decided to ride with a friend on her way to see her husband at work, as we were driving past parts of the city that I have never seen, I was disgusted.  Trash everywhere, it easy to understand that because the mayor have cut monthly bulk trash pick ups and have increased taxes, so people do not want to pay to have it picked up.  So they find a place to dumb it and I guess today out of all days I have found were.  
       My problem is coming from trying to shine a positive light to Detroit due to new development, when they is so much crap going on.  Well I am not completely conquered, there is saying that says "ever day someone dies, every day someone is born".  I guess its like Yin-Yang, but should it be like that, for every good thing that happens in Detroit something bad should follow it.
      Well I will figure this out because I have to write about it.

I wanted my photo essay to reflect a stereotypical and the realistic view of the great city of Detroit. Most of the time the city is viewed in a negative light, and the truth is that there are a lot of negative parts to this city. When many people think of Detroit they fail to realize that there is so much positive parts to the city. They also fail to realize that no place is perfect, you could go to just about any city in the world and find an area of it that will be frowned upon because it is not well financed. I am not doing this to get anyone to feel differently about the city, many of you have made up your minds long ago. I just want you to see that there is more to want you think you know about Detroit. The Projects These are the Jefferies Housing Project established in 1955, and later became known for drug dealing and prostitution. Many of the housing project is set to be demolished in years to come. Burned down and abandoned houses and even closed and burned down businesses. We all know that Detroit is the home of Detroit Lions Detroit Tigers The Fox Theater The State Theater Motor City Casino is one of the three casinos in Detroit. Detroit Red Wings and the Hockey Town Cafe Wayne State University The truth is you will find all these things in this great city, but what many people fail to realize is that there is so much this city has to offer. Crosswind Communities, these are the new apartments being build in downtown on Woodward These are among the 45 Northwest Unity Homes that were build last year. 40 more homes are set to be build this summer. There are so many wonderful restaurants in Detroit, but for some reason Coney Island Restaurants are all over the city. Making Coney Island in my opinion the taste of Detroit. Because there are so many, each restaurant has its own theme that makes them stand out from others. Local businesses are everywhere, helping to make the city unique. Where else can you find a Papa Dee'S Hand Car Wash These liquor stores are also part of Detroit because they are everywhere. These stores allows communitties get simple needs and wants without having to go to far.
Here is the first draft. These is picture of newspaper clipping.

I was watching the TODAY show on NBC and I saw that the "World's  Most Expensive" pizza was in New York.  To be honest, I think that New York is the only city that could really get away with something like this.  The fast paced city is known for pizza, hotdogs, cheese cake, and expenive restaurants.  When I first heard of this I thought that they called it the million dollar pizza, but I was wrong.

I started thinking of all the things that I could do with $1,000.  Well four of those will pay for my tution and I will still have money leaft over to buy a book or two, well maybe just a book.  I could make a good investment, in the stock market with one of those.  With a few of those I could buy a used car, or I could go shopping.

What is Graffiti? To me it is a form of art. Many may say that it's offensive but what isn't. The sweetest gesture could be taken as an insult. The images I have selected show different levels of graffiti. They all show a message even if the message is not understood. From a mother and child, to a piece that looks like it would sell for millions in New York, to telling you what you should do, it is all art.

Looking at the free press, I was using the title of the article to look at what I wanted to read.  The reason why its are to read a paper is because it not "exciting".  There are so many issues going on, but because they are not followed by a comedian, will never be looked at.  The issues that get the most attention I believe are that effect the whole.  ???????????????????

Looking at the free press, I was using the title of the article to look at what I wanted to read.  The reason why its are to read a paper is because it not "exciting".  There are so many issues going on, but because they are not followed by a comedian, will never be looked at.  The issues that get the most attention I believe are that effect the whole.

Today in class we discussed the two articles discussing rap music.  I did not feel comfortable because I was the only black person in the class today.  I knew where the argument was going and it was kind of weird for me.   Rap music is frowned upon today in my opinion, because for so long rappers used it has a tool.  It is not what it used to be but what really is.  I do not promote some of the language used by rappers because I do feel it degrades the race as a whole at time.  Please read previous blog to get my full view....

The songs that I would but on my mix tape representing my attitude towards my neighborhood or my community would be:

What Happened? (which would compare a past Detroit to a present Detroit)
Its Time for a Change!!! (That would encourage people to do something about the city's current state)
Home Sweet Home (There is no place like home, no matter how bad it is)
Home is Not a Four Letter Word (Meaning that home is what you make out of it)
D-E-T-R-O-I-T BASKETBALLLLLLL (Would represent that I am always a fan of the home team)
 Finally, my last song would be something that I would like to have represent the whole world. Union - By the Black Eyed Peas.  The song touched me and I would put it in my mixtape.  

For some reason people are not interested in the positive aspects of music. Rappers said the hottest thing out right now is getting rims put on your car, and many people heard and followed the trend.  But when Nas' was talking about getting an education, everyone heard, but not many people listerned.  

Then again looking at the world today, how many people want hear about the positive things in the world?  Shows like Jerry Springler and Murray are still on television today because people want to see the bad things, happening verses to the good things happening.

My point being that if the CD was to be released, it would get little to no radio time.  Rappers like Common, Talib Kwali, Lupe Fiasco among others do not get as much radio play because the relay messages that tell the truth verse to seeling a dream.  Get rich, buy expensive cars, buy expensive houses, buy expensive clothing, and buy expensive things that you don't need, while the truth is that everyone will not get rich.
I have been extremely tardy in posting my blogs.  I find interesting topics and just forget to put them up.  So from now on, I will try even harder to post at the proper time.

I woke up this morning and I was thinking to myself, today makes the 21st year of a great life for me.  When one is to sit down and think of all the things that has taken place in ones life, personally I can't help but to be thankful.  My life has been saved more than ones, I am healthy, and not missing any body parts.

I have lived in this interesting city for more then 10 years now and I have yet to see its beauty.  I do not hate this city at all, when I am asked where home is I always respond in saying Detroit for now and the reason for that is that this is home for me and that is where the heart is. Detroit has so much history to it and I know very little of it.  Only God knows how many time I have walked and driving around this city and have not seen a building that I have felt should be torn down.  I see a building and just see what it has become not what it used to be.  I see how is a become a little waste land, where people drive by or even walk by and put their trash in it.  When I saw the article on Faded Detroit about the once upon a time Detroit Historic Site, I can't help but to think why keep it?  Is it better to keep it and have it rotting in a city that is trying to improve?
